ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Druid flying solo, mostly.
ygData.msgSnippet: That reminds me, where can I hunt to get my faction good with the people of Rivervale -- without actually having to enter Rivervale (bc I m KOS)? (thought of
ygData.messageBody:
That reminds me, where can I hunt to get my faction good with the people of
Rivervale -- without actually having to enter Rivervale (bc I'm KOS)?
(thought of faction when I remembered something about my faction in CB)
luv,
-Su

> that was my idea too...
>
> snare, dot, panic animal, burn, burn, burn,
> resnare, panic animal, whack it, whack it, whack it...
>
> play PS2 while mana regens
>
> repeat...
>
> boring after a bit..
>
> at 14 go to nro or oasis and join a group there
>
> from 12 - 15 though...i can suggest the throne room of Crushbone if you
can
> get a good group together
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: MLockridge01@... [SMTP:MLockridge01@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, May 02, 2001 10:28 PM
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [EverQuest] Druid flying solo, mostly.
> >
> > I am developing a halfling druid for mostly solo play. I group once
> > in a while, but prefer to develop solo skills. I am a relatively new
> > player, so I am not sure just where I am going.
> >
> > My current goal is attaining level 14, to gain SOW and bind. I then
> > plan to begin traveling and picking up some of the little quests.
> >
> > I am drawn initially toward the Commons. Any suggestions as to what
> > interesting low-level solo quests might be in that area?
> >
> > Barto of Rivervale.
> >
>
